document.docTitle: Haematoloecha nigrorubra subsp. conspicua Rédei & Tsai, 2012, new subspecies
document.masterDocTitle: The assassin bug genus Haematoloecha in Taiwan, with notes on species occurring in the neighbouring areas (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Ectrichodiinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The assassin bug genus Haematoloecha in Taiwan, with notes on species occurring in the neighbouring areas (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Ectrichodiinae)

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 43 – 49. Haematoloecha nigrorubra conspicua ssp. nov., male. 43, head and pronotum, dorsal view; 44, head and thorax, lateral view; 45, fore wing and margin of abdomen, dorsal view; 46, genital capsule, dorsal view; 47, same, ventral view; 48, same, lateral view; 49, dorsoapical process of genital capsule, posterior view. Scales in mm.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 50 – 59. Haematoloecha nigrorubra conspicua ssp. nov., genitalia. 50 – 55, right paramere, six different aspects; 56, phallus, dorsal view; 57, same, lateral view; 58, dorsal sclerotized plate of phallotheca; 59, female genitalia, posterior view. Arrow in Fig. 57 shows aspect of Fig. 58. Scales in mm.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURES 60 – 64. Haematoloecha spp. 60, H. nigrorubra conspicua s sp. nov., holotype; 61, H. rubescens Distant, non-type male from Japan; 62, H. laeta Breddin, lectotype, dorsal view; 63, same, lateral view; 64, same, labels. Scales in mm. (Figs. 62 – 64: © DEIC, photographed by S. M. Blank, published with permission.)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. Holotype
( 3 ): “ Taiwan : Nantou Co. \ Mt. Guandao western \ peak [‘Mt. Guandao western peak’, in Chinese script] \ 2011 .
III. 22 .
leg. [‘Tang Chang-Ti’, in Chinese script]” [printed]; mounted on card, intact; deposited in NMNS (
Fig. 60
). —
Paratypes
( 7 3, 3 ƤƤ ): “ TAIWAN : Hsinchu Co., \ Jiashih, Lidongshan ([‘Lidong’, in Chinese script] \ [‘shan’, in Chinese script]) 2006 .
IV. 8 .
swept \ leg. Tsao WJ.” ( 1 3 , NCHU ); “ TAIWAN : Nantou Co. \ Huisun Experimental For. \ Station [‘Huisun Experimental Forest Station’, in Chinese script] \ 2011 .
IV. 7-8 .
leg. [‘Lai Bao-Cheng’, in Chinese script]” [printed] ( 1 Ƥ, NCHU ); “ TAIWAN : Taichung Co. \ Dasyueshan logging Rd. \ [‘Dasyueshan logging Rd. 19.5 K’, in Chinese script] \ 2011 .
III. 3 .
leg. [‘Hou Shun- Wei’, in Chinese script]” [printed] ( 1 3 , HNHM ); “
2 . IV. 1994
\ [‘Siling’, in Chinese script] \ [‘Chou, W.I.’, in Chinese script]” [with black frame, printed] ( 1 3 , NTU); “
2 . IV. 1994
\ [‘Siling’, in Chinese script] \ [‘Chou, W.I.’, in Chinese script]” [with black frame, printed], “ Haematoloecha \ yunnana \ Hsiao et Ren \ Det.W.Cai,
1997 -VIII
” ( 1 Ƥ, NTU); “Taiheizan \ FORMOSA \
3 IV 1935
” [handwritten + printed] ( 1 3 1 Ƥ, TARI ); “Taiheizan \ FOR- MOSA \
12 V 1935
” [handwritten + printed] ( 2 3 , both dissected, genitalia preserved in plastic microvial with glycerol, pinned with the specimen [
Figs. 46–58
], TARI ); “Taiheizan \ FORMOSA \
16 IX 1935
” [handwritten + printed] ( 1 3 , TARI ).

Other specimens examined. The following specimen is undoubtedly conspecific with the holotype , however, it is excluded from the type series since it is seriously incomplete. — “Taiheizan \ FORMOSA \
12 V 1935
” [handwritten + printed] (
1 specimen
, abdomen lacking, TARI ).

Diagnosis. Distinguished from the nominotypical subspecies
H. nigrorubra nigrorubra
by the red head with blackish suffusion medially, red femora, and red abdominal venter.

Colour .
General colour bright red with black pattern; head and labium red, vertex with a broad blackish suffusion medially extending from level of antenniferous tubercles to that of posterior margin of eyes, postocular part with indistinct dark suffusion ventrolaterally; antennal segment I brown, remaining segments blackish; prothorax bright red, proepisternum suffused with brown anteroventrally and posteriorly; scutellum bright red, its base, lateral portions, and median impression suffused with black; meso- and metathoracic pleura and sterna blackish brown with more or less distinct reddish suffusion on supracoxal lobes; fore wing bright red, most of clavus and adjacent elongated membranous area of corium dark brown, membrane black with a small whitish patch at apex of clavus; abdominal dorsum and venter bright red, connexivum uniformly red or apical halves of connexival segments II–VI with slight blackish suffusion, sternite II blackish except its extreme lateral portions; coxae, trochanters and femora bright red, tibiae bright red, apical halves of fore and mid and extreme apex of hind tibia brown, tarsi light brown.

Etymology. Subspecific epithet from Latin conspicuus ‘apparent, conspicuous’, referring to the conspicuous bright red head and legs of the new subspecies in contrast with the nominotypical subspecies. Adjective.
